column1: The Far Downs were the downlands that marked the former western borders of the Shire
column2: forty leagues (120 miles) west from the Brandywine Bridge. Of their geography almost nothing is known
column3: except that the town of Greenholm seems to have been built among the Downs.

column1: King Aragorn extended the Shires borders westward to the Tower Hills in
column2: with the Westmarch laying in-between. Fastred of Greenholm became the first Warden of Westmarch.
